record.field: Warning: document template of ${ctx['db_name']} - ${ctx['company_id'].name} has been modified

Dear ${object.name},

You receive this email because we would like to be sure that you are the person who changed the document template of company ${ctx['company_id'].name} at ${ctx['timestamp']}. If you don't remember doing such action, it means your user credentials might be in the hands of a scammer. When they get user credentials, scammers common schemes are the following:

  • Changing the footer of your document layout to invite your customers to pay invoices on a scam bank account.
  • Changing the bank account(s) of the company (same purpose).
  • Changing the bank account(s) for your vendors so you pay your bills on a scam bank account.

That's why you will receive warning mails like this each time one of those actions is performed. If you think you are victim of a scam:

  • Change your user password (use a strong one). Also check that you don't use the same password for other purposes as well. Those accounts could be compromised as well.
  • Log in company ${ctx['company_id'].name} and have a look on the document layout in the general settings. Check if everything is correct with a particular focus on bank account numbers displayed and make corrections where necessary.
  • If you had to fix the document layout, then check no sales invoices were sent between ${ctx['timestamp']} and now. Contact your customers if necessary.
